result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Francisco J Chavez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Francisco J Chavez was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Balance of $1000.00 refunded to poster.

Defendant Francisco J Chavez appeared by phone from Oshkosh Correctional Institution.  Attorney John Paul Marchan appeared in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Poster Jose Lazcano appeared in court.  Mr. Lazcano moves to have the bail he posted returned to him.  Attorney Marchan makes statements.  Court makes statements.  
Court will return $1000.00 of the bail posted to Mr. Jose Lazcano.  
Court requires the defendant pay the money immediately.  Inlieu of the $1,000.00, defendant to serve 10 days Huber consecutive to his previous 6 months jail sentence.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 09:30 am

dated November 23, 2015 from Atty Mary Roth, regarding return of bail money posted by Jose Lezcano

Defendant Francisco J Chavez in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingwel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 2 and 4.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 2 and 4.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Count #5 is dismissed by operation of law.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Marchan makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #2.  
6 months jail concurrent to any other sentences he is serving.  (Credit -8 days).  
Costs:  $243.00.  Court orders in lieu of payment of fine, defendant is to serve 3 days jail, consecutive to the 6 months jail, concurrent to any other sentence.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #4.  
200 Days Jail concurrent to any other sentences he is serving.  (Credit -8 days). 
FINE:  $2452.00.  
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Waukesha Police Department.
Total amounts due to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 1/1/2018.  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate sentence of 24 days 
DL REVOCATION:  30 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 30 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through
